intro: Drypetes sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran drypetes, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in lowland and hill forests, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
